de.tif.jacob.screen.event
Interface IHotkeyEventHandler

public interface IHotkeyEventHandler

The listener interface for receiving keyboard events (keystrokes). A GUIElement must implement this interface that is interested in processing a hotkey event.

Since:
2.7.2

Method Summary
 int getKeyMask(IClientContext context)
          The bitwise-or of the hot key constants.
 void keyPressed(IClientContext context, KeyEvent event)
          This method will be called if an hotkey has been detected.
 

Method Detail

keyPressed

void keyPressed(IClientContext context,
                KeyEvent event)
                throws java.lang.Exception
This method will be called if an hotkey has been detected.
Default action of the form will not be called (e.g. Search, Save,...).

Parameters:
context - The current client context
event - The key event
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getKeyMask

int getKeyMask(IClientContext context)
The bitwise-or of the hot key constants. Only key events which are part of the mask will be send to the server.
Return KeyEvent.VK_ENTER if you want receive the Enter key or 0 if you want to receive nothing.

This method will be called after each onGroupStatusChanged event.

Parameters:
context - The current client context
Returns:
The bitwise-or of the hot key constants which are defined in KeyEvent.
See Also:
KeyEvent
